intro: Aizoon hirsutum, commonly known as the hairy aizoon, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, giving it a distinctive appearance. Aizoon hirsutum is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
